intro: Hieracium worochtae, commonly known as the Worochta hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
